programmes.show_description: Mark has collapsed on a tennis court. Harry has hurt his head playing football. Newly qualified consultant Dr Mehrad talks about the pressures and satisfaction of his job.
...Jon Richardson: Brand new series - The pub's renovation hots up, as underfloor heating's laid and the old iron light fittings are restored. And things get spooky at a fundraiser. (Ep3)
Heli-medics race to a skydiver who's suffered serious injuries after crashing into a house. And there's a race across the country to reach a man who's fallen 40 feet from a ladder.
Mark has collapsed on a tennis court. Harry has hurt his head playing football. Newly qualified consultant Dr Mehrad talks about the pressures and satisfaction of his job.
More favourite investigations. Kate and Helen get the scoop on vanilla. In the Netherlands, Matt explores the myth that Edam balls were once used as emergency cannon balls!
Discover the very latest must-haves for your home and garden with Must Have Ideas
Discover the very latest must-haves for your home and garden with Must Have Ideas
On day four in Cagliari, Adam takes his guests cheesemaking. Is it to everyone's taste or a bit of a stinker? And his glass-bottom boat trip gives some of them a sinking feeling. (Ep19/20)

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: In this first-ever episode, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien unearth a church pew, create a fish tank from scrap and uncover a very special petrol tank.
Kim and Rob love the traditional white villages of Andalucía, the Pueblos Blancos, and are looking for a bolthole to enjoy with all the family. Can Danni Menzies find their ideal property?
Milton Keynes. Hypnotherapist Howard, who loves competition, hopes to enchant his rivals with his intriguingly named food. But his 'Pendulum of Truth' is not everyone's idea of fun. (Ep1/5)
Milton Keynes. Outspoken Louise plans a 'fabulous' menu including 'Lou's magical mousse'. But it's a night of cutting criticism and probing questions. (Ep2/5)
Milton Keynes. Management consultant David entertains his guests with some Vegas showgirls, but makes a major blunder with his food when he mixes up the vegetarian and meat mains. (Ep3/5)
Milton Keynes. Customer services manager Helen plans an authentic Indian menu, on a night of glamorous discoveries and dodgy disguises. (Ep4/5)
Milton Keynes. Salesman Simon goes all out to impress with his fine-dining fare. But will he be thrown off course by some of his guests' low blows? (Ep5/5)
John Whitworth welcomes his guests to the quirky The Edge Accommodation in Huddersfield. But a revelation about what's behind some of the doors makes the group feel uneasy.
Best friends Sally and Teresa pride themselves on the community spirit at Darwin Lake Holiday Village in Matlock. But accusations of cheating fly when the guests compete in a sports day.
The third visit is to Sands Resort Hotel and Spa in Newquay, where father and son Nicholas and Tom Malcolm's facilities include a maze. But John gets in a lather over bubble bath.
Phil Gilbert takes his guests back to basics at the Oak Tree Lane Yurt Site in Bratton Clovelly, Devon. They're wowed by the Mongolian yurts, but there are some home truths at dinner.
It's the final day of the competition and the B&Bers meet for the last time. There are tears, name-calling and bitter rebukes as the payments are revealed and the winner is announced.
Toyota FJ40 Land Cruiser: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend visit south Wales to restore Adam's 1984 Toyota FJ40 Land Cruiser, a four-by-four that went off road for the wrong reasons.
Subaru Impreza: In Derbyshire, Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend restore Matt's 1999 Subaru Impreza Turbo 2000, a Japanese all-wheel-drive monster tamed by a serious dose of rust.
Will escape artist Jerry scupper her chances at a new life? Lisa longs for a lapdog. And is bouncy bull Arab puppy Reil too much for the Steele family to handle?
Can Evie the lurcher help Spanish street dog Billy manage his fear of people? And is Bear the right Yorkipoo for new couple Justin and Richard?
Brand new series: Can Carol raise funds for an assistance dog with her late mum's porcelain collection? And will a Picasso turn Peter and Julia's bargain break into a luxury escape? (Ep2/6)
New parents Danny and Jordan are worried that five-day-old Gracie may have an infected umbilical cord. They talk about life changes and the joy of becoming parents.
Fifteen-year-old Meldred is rushed into A&E after being stabbed in the thigh by a stranger while walking to school. Sports commentator Andrew has a mysterious rash on his ankle.
Brand new series: Can Carol raise funds for an assistance dog with her late mum's porcelain collection? And will a Picasso turn Peter and Julia's bargain break into a luxury escape? (Ep2/6)
New parents Danny and Jordan are worried that five-day-old Gracie may have an infected umbilical cord. They talk about life changes and the joy of becoming parents.
Fifteen-year-old Meldred is rushed into A&E after being stabbed in the thigh by a stranger while walking to school. Sports commentator Andrew has a mysterious rash on his ankle.
A selection of favourite investigations. Kate Quilton visits McVitie's to ask why biscuits have little holes all over them. Jimmy Doherty finds out how wine bottle corks are made.
Discover the very latest must-haves for your home and garden with Must Have Ideas
Discover the very latest must-haves for your home and garden with Must Have Ideas
On the last day in Cagliari, magician Dave plans a morning of water sports, but one of his guests can't swim. At dinner, Dave reveals his magical talents... and the winning host. (Ep20/20)

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: In East Sussex and Hertfordshire, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien's finds include a Victorian egg incubator.
Cliff and Angela want to buy a Spanish holiday home near Cabo Roig, where they can enjoy extended breaks with their grown-up children. Laura Hamilton lines up five options for their £100k.
Southend-on-Sea. Dog-mad PA Julie-Ann serves up a surfing theme, with two fish dishes and a surf shack in her garden. There's a shock when glamorous guest Carol reveals her age. (Ep1/5)
Southend-on-Sea. Glamorous grandmother Carol Dolman puts on a dazzling display, on a night featuring saucy discoveries, flirty tango lessons and a wig reveal. (Ep2/5)
Southend-on-Sea. Science teacher and self-confessed geek Damian experiments with a spicy menu and a chemistry demo. But Scott brands his main the worst dish he's ever eaten... (Ep3/5)
Southend-on-Sea. Bartender and self-confessed 'airhead' Steph Barrett hosts a 1940s fancy dress night. But she has to call on her nan to bail her out with a pastry problem. (Ep4/5)
Southend-on-Sea. International DJ Scott Langley hosts with a risky menu and an 'outrageous' dress code. But how will his pigeon main go down with his guests? (Ep5/5)
Farmer's daughter Mandy and her friend Anny host first at Laskill Country House in Helmsley. Mandy bigs up her banger qualifications, but at breakfast she fails to crack Chris's order.
Chris and his spiritual friend Rammy hope that value for money and a Yorkshire pudding competition will bag them the prize at The Swan Hotel in Telford. But one guest has a rude awakening.
Colin and his son Ben hope to wow their rivals with their 81-room country pile, Scalford Hall Hotel, in Melton Mowbray. But guests Chris and Rammy think that Colin is playing games.
The last visit is to The Abbey Hotel in Battle, East Sussex, run by youngsters Charlie and Lauren. But Colin and Ben feel the squeeze, and Chris and Rammy get into a sticky situation.
It's the final day of the competition and the B&Bers meet for the last time. There are recriminations and accusations as the payments are revealed and the winner is announced.
Messerschmitt KR200: In Devon, Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend restore a 1958 Messerschmitt KR200 bubble car for classic car fan Sam.
Ford Capri Mk1: In North Yorkshire, Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend restore Helen's 1974 Mk1 Ford Capri, which is in so many pieces that it's almost impossible to tell what it is.
Could cuddly fluffball Jinglebells become Kelly's new BFF? Cute Maltese cross Marshmallow is swept off his paws. Border collie Frankie makes a beeline for Nicci.
Beth and Jemima want an outgoing pup to fit their friendship group. Tina needs a bold companion. And Max is a dog in mourning - could a new best friend help?
Brand new series - Baptism for the Dead: A Mormon's death echoes the past. But is it a murder or an incomprehensible suicide? In French/subs.
Sir Robert, who's 93, is rushed to St George's with a low heart rate. Brad, who's crushed his finger at work, talks about what masculinity means to him and male role models.
